titles.title: Trade Act Amendments of 1986
A bill to amend the Trade Act of 1974 to provide for appointment of additional official advisers to United States trade delegations.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 6/11/1987--Introduced. Trade Act Amendments of 1986 - Amends the Trade Act of 1974 to require the appointment as additional official advisers to the U.S. delegations to international trade negotiations of members from: (1) the House Committees on Agriculture, Appropriations, Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs, Energy and Commerce, and Foreign Affairs; and (2) the Senate Committees on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry, Appropriations, Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs, Commerce, Science, and Transportation, and Foreign Relations. Authorizes the disclosure of confidential trade secrets and commercial or financial information submitted in connection with trade negotiations to such advisers.
